0.title: ⬆️ language-css@0.44.1
0.body:
List of changes between languagec-css@0.44.1 and language-css@0.44.1: https://github.com/atom/language-css/compare/v0.44.0...v0.44.1

Refs: https://github.com/atom/language-css/pull/166 (Thanks for the contributions, @Hyftar 🙇)

**Release notes**
Adds syntax highlighting support to grid properties e.g `row-gap`, `place-items`, `place-self` and
`place-content`

1.title: ⬆️ github@0.31.1
1.body:
*List of changes between `github@0.31.0` and `github@0.31.1`: https://github.com/atom/github/compare/v0.31.0...v0.31.1*

Refs: https://github.com/atom/github/pull/2326 (Thanks @darangi for co-authoring this PR)

### Release Notes

- atom/github#2324: Removed the non-functional "jump to file" context menu option when viewing past commits.
- atom/github#2308: Explicitly display and choose the active git working directory in the Git and GitHub tabs. (Thanks @wadethestealth!)
- atom/github#2305: Fixed a crash when viewing review comments on Windows.
- atom/github#2297: Avoid stalls due to data buffering by using TCP sockets instead of UNIX domain sockets for git dialog communications.
- atom/github#2222: Create and publish GitHub repositories with the `github:create-repository` and `github:publish-repository` commands.
- atom/github#2270: Copy the commit SHA and subject to the clipboard from the context menu on the mini-log. (Thanks @zetter!)

2.title: ⬆️ language-php@0.44.4
2.body:
List of changes between language-php@0.44.3 and language-php@0.44.4: https://github.com/atom/language-php/compare/v0.44.3...v0.44.4

Refs: https://github.com/atom/language-php/pull/368 (Thanks for the contributions, @KapitanOczywisty! 🙇)

**Release Notes**

Functions returning references are now correctly colored.
Return types are now correctly identified and colored.
Return types are now allowed to include namespaces.

3.title: Bump Tree-sitter to 0.15.14
3.body: This updates Tree-sitter to include this change: https://github.com/tree-sitter/tree-sitter/pull/475.

4.title: Update License for One Dark Theme from 2016 to 2019
4.body:
### Requirements for Contributing a Performance Improvement

* Fill out the template below. Any pull request that does not include enough information to be reviewed in a timely manner may be closed at the maintainers' discretion.
* The pull request must only affect performance of existing functionality. To contribute other changes, you must use a different template. You can see all templates at <https://github.com/atom/.github/tree/master/.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE>.
* After you create the pull request, all status checks must be pass before a maintainer reviews your contribution. For more details, please see <https://github.com/atom/.github/tree/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests>.

### Description of the Change

I updated the license for the One Dark theme from 2016 to 2019, because it's no longer 2016 and it's best policy to keep license up to date. 

### Quantitative Performance Benefits

Quantitatively, an updated license will increase performance by allowing other people perform useful tasks instead of worrying about outdated license.

### Possible Drawbacks

This change might be a hassle and a waste of time of those who review and approve it.

### Verification Process

It's a single character change in a file that does not affect the application's behavior. 

### Applicable Issues

N/A

### Release Notes

The Atom One Dark theme licence was updated for 2019.


-----
[View rendered packages/one-dark-syntax/LICENSE.md](https://github.com/Tloru/atom/blob/patch-1/packages/one-dark-syntax/LICENSE.md)
